summary: This is a search warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York authorizing the search of a multi-story single-family residence in New York, New York, believed to contain evidence related to violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 and 1591 (sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors). The warrant specifies the seizure of electronic devices and storage media containing evidence such as communications with victims, photographs, and records of ownership/access.

persons.name: Henry Pitman
persons.context: Issued the search warrant, authorizing the search and seizure of property related to the investigation.

events.title: Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The search warrant must be executed on or before this date, as commanded by the court.

events.title: Warrant Issuance
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman issued the search warrant based on probable cause.

locations: Subject Premises: a multi-story single-family residence located in New York, New York
keyFacts: The search warrant targets a residence in New York, NY for evidence of sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. § 1591) and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371).

Items to be seized include computer devices, storage media, and any items facilitating forensic examination, with a focus on electronically stored information like communications with victims and suggestive photographs of teenage girls.
The warrant authorizes the creation of forensic images of seized devices and the use of various techniques, including keyword searches and metadata review, to locate responsive data.
The warrant was issued on July 2, 2019, and must be executed by July 12, 2019, with delayed notice authorized due to potential adverse results.
